children.name: 1-PS4-1
children.description: Plan and conduct investigations to provide evidence that vibrating materials can make sound and that sound can make materials vibrate.

children.name: 1-PS4-2
children.description: Make observations to construct an evidence-based account that objects in darkness can be seen only when illuminated.

children.name: 1-PS4-3
children.description: Plan and conduct investigations to determine the effect of placing objects made with different materials in the path of a beam of light.

children.name: 1-PS4-4
children.description: Use tools and materials to design and build a device that uses light or sound to solve the problem of communicating over a distance.

children.name: 1-LS1-1
children.description: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts to help them survive, grow, and meet their needs.

children.name: 1-LS1-2
children.description: Read texts and use media to determine patterns in behavior of parents and offspring that help offspring survive.

children.name: 1-LS3-1
children.description: Make observations to construct an evidence-based account that young plants and animals are like, but not exactly like, their parents.

children.name: 1-ESS1-1
children.description: Use observations of the sun, moon, and stars to describe patterns that can be predicted.

children.name: 1-ESS1-2
children.description: Make observations at different times of year to relate the amount of daylight to the time of year.
